summary: This bill mandates the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) to establish a comprehensive system to track, record, and report all instances where US citizens or lawful permanent residents are detained or removed for immigration enforcement purposes. The system must report to Congress quarterly and include details about detentions exceeding 24 hours and removals, including those involving individuals under 18 or removed with a parent/guardian lacking legal status. The bill also requires DHS to create a process for individuals to submit proof of citizenship or permanent residency. Specific congressional committees are defined, and the term "removed" is defined.
